text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

There has been a lot going on so I wanted
to make an

update video for you guys to keep you in the
loop.

And yes, I do have little ears on today, I’m
going to a Halloween thing

later tonight so I thought, just leave them
on, make a video and
head out the door afterwards.

So the first thing are collabs, I’ve done
a lot of them and I have a
really cool special one coming up soon.

Next week’s episode of Nerdy Nummies is
gonna have a very special guest,

you guys will never believe who it’s gonna
be!

He’s blue, he loves chocolate chip cookies,
it’s Cookie Monster!

I’m so excited for next Tuesday, we had
so much fun!

My favorite character from Sesame Street growing
up was Cookie Monster,

so getting to bake with Cookie Monster, in
my home, in my own kitchen,
beyond a dream come true!
Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!
It was a part of Sesame Street’s Love toLearn campaign, we also made a video on their channel,
so I will put a link down below to the Sesame Street YouTube Channel, go check it out on

Tuesday because we did a collab video over there
as well!

Some of the other collabs that I’ve done
are: I played the cheese pizza

challenge with Justine, we also played the
Starbucks Challenge Part 2,
fall drinks!

I made some Geode cupcakes with Joey, from
the

Nerdy Nummies Cookbook, and on Joey’s channel
we deconstructed some

Barbie and Ken Dolls, and reconstructed them
to our liking.

I felt a little bit like Frankenstein, so,
that kind of felt perfect for
the Halloween season.
And went on Grace’s podcast, Not Too Deep.

I’ll put a link to everything that I’m
talking about down below if you

missed those videos and you want to go check them
out, they’ll be down there!

In addition to those collabs, I got to be
a part of an animation

project called Emo Dad, Season 2, where I
voiced the character Miss Blissful.
She was a sweet, nerdy, librarian love interest.

It was a really fun show made by the Fine
Brothers, and also, on

the Fine Brothers, they released a Kid’s
React to Rosanna Pansino and

Nerdy Nummies, and I got a huge kick out of
it you guys.
It was so funny, I was like, oh!
It’s so funny, but it’s also embarrassing.
I love you guys, thank you for the love!
Then in Cookbook news!
Dee-dee, da-dee-dee!

The Nerdy Nummies Cookbook is almost approaching
it’s 1 year anniversary!

It’s in 5 days, it came out last year, November
3rd!

And to celebrate, I thought, let’s do a
giveaway, what better way to celebrate.

So there can be 20 winners, I’m gonna be
giving out

20 copies of the book, in these cute little
care packets, it will come

with a spatula and stickers and mini posters,
bunch of little fun stuff in there!

If you’re interested in entering the giveaway,
you can go to

NerdyNummiesCookbook.com, I’ll put a link
down below, and just fill out the
little form!

Then in event news you guys, we made it into
2 People Magazines this year.
This is amazing.

In the regular People Magazine with Ellen
on the cover,
hey Ellen!

I love her Dance moves, and the game Heads
Up!

I’ve played it a bunch, it’s pretty good,
nice job!
High five, boop! OK!

It’s one of our Halloween Recipes, they
put it on Page 89, you’ll find

our Mint Chocolate Chip Frankenstein Crispy
Bars.

Then in the special edition of People’s
Holiday Recipes, we are right up

front, we are page 6 and 7, we got a 2 page
spread.

We gave a Halloween recipe, they are Halloween
Mummy Dogs, or as
I like to call them, they’re Hallo-Weenies!

So, if you want to check them out, these are
the 2 magazines we

were in and a big thank you to People for
featuring our recipes!
That was super sweet of you!
Mags! Mags! Mags! Mags! Mags!

I will be attending Cookie Con next year 2017,
and I know what you’re

thinking, Ro, whoa! that’s really far in
advance.

But I just wanted to tell you as soon as I
knew, so if you guys wanted to
come to a meetup!

Last year was so much fun, we did a panel, and
a big meet and greet,

they’re already selling early-bird tickets,
so I just wanted to tell you

as soon as I knew, and I’ll put a link down
below.

Lastly, in YouTube news, I have been getting
a lot of questions, so I am
here to answer them!
1, when do I upload?

A new Nerdy Nummies comes out every Tuesday,
and lately, I have been uploading
a second video on Saturdays.
Sometimes it’s a vlog, sometimes I am

playing a game with a friend, sometime’s
I am making an additional recipe,

just for funsies, sometimes I’m doing arts
and crafts.

So Saturday’s upload is just a surprise,
a fun day!

Secondly, along with that, I’ve been getting
a lot of questions about

notifications, so I wanted to show you how
to turn Notifications on in
the settings if you would like to.

To turn on Notifications, you’re gonna go
to my channel, which is
YouTube.com/RosannaPansino and Subscribe.

To Subscribe to the channel you click the
red button, and once subscribed,
you'll click on the little bell.
Then a message will pop up and you’re gonna
want to check the box next to the

‘Send me all notifications for this channel’
and click Save.
And that’s it!
Easy-Peasy, Lemon-Squeezy!

Third and final thing is subscribing to my
YouTube channel is free!

As long as you have a YouTube account, you
can subscribe.

Alright, that does it for the update video,
those are all of the things
that I have going on.

I hope you guys enjoyed it, and I hope you
have a Hoppy Halloween…
A hoppy…
Haha, get it!?
Because I look like a bunny!
Alright, bye-bye!
How’s my little floppy pumpkin?
Who’s a floppy pumpkin!?
Who’s a floppy Pumpkin?
It’s Cookie!
It’s Cookie!
It’s Cookie, Cookie, Cookie!
